Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a plain discus, decorated on the shoulder with impressed ovolos. At the rear is a broken ring handle with a floral pattern at its junction with the discus-rim, and an impressed pattern below the spine. Within the base-ring are four cardinally-placed small ovolos, and the impressed name FAVST, with an S below. Covered with a red-brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2010.bis)
